translation.title: Sargassum invasion live map, webcams and beach reporting
translation.description: Get latest beach statuses crowdsourced worldwide and monitor the invasion of pellagic sargassum through weekly, monthly trends, and live webcams.
translation.Welcome: sargassum.watch allows you to monitor sargassum invasions around the world
translation.Zoom on the map to reveal clean beaches: Zoom on the map to reveal clean beaches
translation.Click on the eyes to watch live beach we: Click on the eyes to watch live beach webcams
translation.Report the presence of sargasses at your: Report the presence of sargasses at your position with the blue button
translation.na help: Moderate to critical beaching, the source does not specify.
translation.Last 7 days reports: Last 7 days reports in the area
translation.Last 4 weeks reports: Last 4 weeks reports in the area
translation.Last 12 months reports: Last 12 months reports in the area
translation.Please get closer to the beach: Approach a beach to report its status
translation.about us: sargassum.watch is a community-driven project to monitor sargassum beaching waves around the world.
translation.about sargassum: Originating off the coast of Brazil, these brown seaweeds have been stranded massively on the Caribbean coasts since 2011, they trap sea turtles and stink the air. A phenomenon that has significant ecological and economical consequences.
translation.about data: The data presented here come from our users as well as from third party sites. When the data does not come directly from a user of the site, the source is indicated on the relevant point on the map.
We're now aware of your issue and we'll take action quickly, thank you for your patience.
